info.title: Patreon API
info.description: An unofficial OpenAPI schema for the V2 Patreon API. Made based on the official api with https://github.com/ghostrider-05/patreon-api.ts

externalDocs.description: Official Patreon documentation
Resource endpoints documentation
Webhook endpoints documentation

400.description: Something was wrong with your request (syntax, size too large, etc.)

401.description: Authentication failed (bad API key, invalid OAuth token, incorrect scopes, etc.)

scopes.identity:
Provides read access to data about the user.
See the /identity endpoint documentation for details about what data is available.
scopes.identity[email]: Provides read access to the user’s email.
scopes.identity.memberships: Provides read access to the user’s memberships.
scopes.campaigns:
Provides read access to basic campaign data.
See the /campaign endpoint documentation for details about what data is available.
scopes.campaigns.members:
Provides read access to data about a campaign’s members.
See the /members endpoint documentation for details about what data is available.
Also allows the same information to be sent via webhooks created by your client.
scopes.campaigns.members[email]:
Provides read access to the member’s email.
Also allows the same information to be sent via webhooks created by your client.
scopes.campaigns.members.address:
Provides read access to the member’s address, if an address was collected in the pledge flow.
Also allows the same information to be sent via webhooks created by your client.
scopes.campaigns.posts: Provides read access to the posts on a campaign.
scopes.w:campaigns.webhook: Provides read, write, update, and delete access to the campaign’s webhooks created by the client.

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Address resource

phone_number.description: Telephone number. Specified for non-US addresses

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Benefit resource

app_external_id.description: The third-party external ID this reward is associated with

app_meta.description: Any metadata the third-party app included with this benefit on creation

benefit_type.description: Type of benefit, such as `custom` for creator-defined benefits

deliverables_due_today_count.description: Number of deliverables for this benefit that are due today specifically

delivered_deliverables_count.description: Number of deliverables for this benefit that have been marked complete

is_deleted.description: Whether this benefit has been deleted

is_ended.description: Whether this benefit is no longer available to new patrons

is_published.description: Whether this benefit is ready to be fulfilled to patrons

next_deliverable_due_date.description: The next due date (after EOD today) for this benefit

not_delivered_deliverables_count.description: Number of deliverables for this benefit that are due, for all dates

rule_type.description: A rule type designation, such as `eom_monthly` or `one_time_immediate`

tiers_count.description: Number of tiers containing this benefit

campaign.title: Campaign
campaign.description: The creator's page, and the top-level object for accessing lists of members, tiers, etc

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Campaign resource

url.description: The url to visit this campaign

thanks_video_url.description: The URL of the video that is shown to patrons after pledging

thanks_msg.description: The message that is shown to patrons after pledging

thanks_embed.description: The embed that is shown to patrons after pledging

summary.description:
The summary of this campaign.
Can be viewed in the About section of the campaign

show_earnings.description: Whether the campaign's total earnings are shown publicly

rss_feed_title.description: The title of the campaigns rss feed

rss_artwork_url.description: The url for the rss album artwork

published_at.description:
Datetime that the creator most recently published (made publicly visible) the campaign.
Null when the campaign has not been public.

pledge_url.description: Relative (to patreon.com) URL for the pledge checkout flow for this campaign

pay_per_name.description: The thing which patrons are paying per, as in "{@link Campaign.vanity} is making $1000 per {@link Campaign.pay_per_name}"

patron_count.description: Number of patrons pledging to this creator

one_liner.description: Pithy one-liner for this campaign, displayed on the creator page

is_nsfw.description: Whether the creator has marked the campaign as containing nsfw content

is_monthly.description: Whether the campaign charges per month

image_url.description: Banner image URL for the campaign

image_small_url.description: Profile image URL for the campaign

has_sent_rss_notify.description: Whether the creator has sent a one-time rss notification email

has_rss.description: Whether this user has opted-in to rss feeds

google_analytics_id.description: The ID of the Google Analytics tracker that the creator wants metrics to be sent to

discord_server_id.description: The ID of the external discord server that is linked to this campaign

creation_name.description: The type of content the creator is creating, as in "{@link Campaign.vanity} is creating {@link Campaign.creation_name}"

created_at.description: Datetime that the creator first began the campaign creation process

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the OauthClient resource

author_name.description: The author name provided during client setup.

default_scopes.description: The client's default OAuth scopes for the authorization flow.

description.description: The description provided during client setup.

domain.description: The domain provided during client setup.

icon_url.description: The URL of the icon used in the OAuth authorization flow.

name.description: The name provided during client setup.

privacy_policy_url.description: The URL of the privacy policy provided during client setup.

redirect_uris.description: The allowable redirect URIs for the OAuth authorization flow.

tos_url.description: The URL of the terms of service provided during client setup.

version.description: The Patreon API version the client is targeting.

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Deliverable resource

completed_at.description: When the creator marked the deliverable as completed or fulfilled to the patron

due_at.description: When the deliverable is due to the patron

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Goal resource
Official documentation for the Media resource

download_url.description: The URL to download this media. Valid for 24 hours.

image_urls.description: The resized image URLs for this media. Valid for 2 weeks.

owner_relationship.description: Ownership relationship type for multi-relationship medias

owner_type.description: Type of the resource that owns the file

upload_parameters.description: All the parameters that have to be added to the upload form request

upload_url.description: The URL to perform a POST request to in order to upload the media file

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Member resource

campaign_lifetime_support_cents.description:
The total amount that the member has ever paid to the campaign in campaign's currency.
0 if never paid

currently_entitled_amount_cents.description:
The amount in cents that the member is entitled to.
This includes a current pledge, or payment that covers the current payment period

email.description:
The member's email address.
Requires the campaigns.members[email] scope

full_name.description: Full name of the member user

is_follower.description: The user is not a pledging patron but has subscribed to updates about public posts

last_charge_date.description:
Datetime of last attempted charge.
`null` if never charged

last_charge_status.description:
The result of the last attempted charge.
The only successful status is `'Paid'`.
`null` if never charged

Note: this will likely be either `'Paid'` or `'Pending'`

lifetime_support_cents.description:
The total amount that the member has ever paid to the campaign.
0 if never paid

next_charge_date.description:
Datetime of next charge.
`null` if annual pledge downgrade

note.description: The creator's notes on the member

patron_status.description: A `null` value indicates the member has never pledged

pledge_cadence.description:
Number of months between charges

Note: this will be `1` if Campaign.is_monthly is `true`

pledge_relationship_start.description:
Datetime of beginning of most recent pledge chainfrom this member to the campaign.
Pledge updates do not change this value

will_pay_amount_cents.description: The amount in cents the user will pay at the next pay cycle

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Post resource

embed_data.description: An object containing embed data if media is embedded in the post

is_paid.description: Whether the post incurs a bill as part of a pay-per-post campaign

is_public.description:
- `true` if the post is viewable by anyone
- `false` if only patrons (or a subset of patrons) can view

published_at.description: Datetime that the creator most recently published (made publicly visible) the post

tiers.description:
The tier ids that allow the patrons from those tiers to view the post.
Empty array if no tiers assigned even if {@link Post.is_paid} is true

url.description: A URL to access this post on patreon.com

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the PledgeEvent resource

amount_cents.description: Amount (in the currency in which the patron paid) of the underlying event

currency_code.description: ISO code of the currency of the event

date.description: The date which this event occurred

tier_id.description: Id of the tier associated with the pledge

tier_title.description: Title of the reward tier associated with the pledge

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Tier resource

amount_cents.description: Monetary amount associated with this tier (in U.S. cents)

discord_role_ids.description: The discord role IDs granted by this tier

image_url.description: Full qualified image URL associated with this tier

patron_count.description: Number of patrons currently registered for this tier

post_count.description: Number of posts published to this tier

published.description: Whether the tier is currently published

published_at.description: Datetime this tier was last published

remaining.description: Remaining number of patrons who may subscribe, if there is a {@link Tier.user_limit}

requires_shipping.description: Whether this tier requires a shipping address from patrons

unpublished_at.description: Datetime tier was unpublished, while applicable

url.description: Fully qualified URL associated with this tier

user_limit.description: Maximum number of patrons this tier is limited to, if applicable

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the User resource

about.description: The user's about text, which appears on their profile

can_see_nsfw.description: Whether this user can view nsfw content

created.description: Datetime of this user's account creation

email.description:
The user's email address.
Requires certain scopes to access.
See the scopes section of the documentation

hide_pledges.description: Whether the user has chosen to keep private which creators they pledge to

image_url.description: The user's profile picture URL, scaled to width 400px

is_email_verified.description: Whether the user has confirmed their email

like_count.description: How many posts this user has liked

thumb_url.description: The user's profile picture URL, scaled to a square of size 100x100px

url.description: URL of this user's creator or patron profile

vanity.description:
The public "username" of the user.
patreon.com/ goes to this user's creator page.
Non-creator users might not have a vanity.

externalDocs.description: Official documentation for the Webhook resource

last_attempted_at.description: Last date that the webhook was attempted or used.

num_consecutive_times_failed.description: Number of times the webhook has failed consecutively, when in an error state.

paused.description:
`true` if the webhook is paused as a result of repeated failed attempts to post to uri.
Set to `false` to attempt to re-enable a previously failing webhook.

secret.description: Secret used to sign your webhook message body, so you can validate authenticity upon receipt.

triggers.description: List of events that will trigger this webhook.

uri.description: Fully qualified uri where webhook will be sent (e.g. https://www.example.com/webhooks/incoming).
